title: Fix bottom navigation icons clipping and shift icons left

requirements.text: Fix the bottom navigation bar layout so the far-right Profile tab (icon + label) is no longer clipped/cut off on any screen size, including devices with right safe-area insets.

quotes: the bottom navigation bar icon on the far right (the profile icon) is being cut off,
It is cut off on all screen size

acceptanceCriteria: On Home/Trending/Create/Notifications/Profile routes, the Profile tab icon and label are fully visible (no clipping) at common viewport widths (mobile, tablet, desktop).
The bottom bar still respects safe-area insets (left/right/bottom) and remains fixed to the bottom without overlapping OS navigation areas.
No horizontal scrolling is introduced by the bottom tab bar.

requirements.text: Shift all bottom navigation bar tabs slightly to the left (as a group) while keeping spacing visually balanced and consistent across screen sizes.

quotes: Let all the bottom  icon be slightly shifted to the left side
I want the profile icons slightly shifted to the left side

acceptanceCriteria: All five bottom tabs appear horizontally shifted left by a small, consistent amount (e.g., via asymmetric container padding/offset) without any single tab looking misaligned relative to the others.
After the shift, the Profile tab remains fully visible and is not closer than a reasonable touch-safe margin from the right edge/safe-area inset.
Tab hit areas remain comfortably tappable (no reduction in button size below current behavior).

constraints: Do not modify any files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only).
Do not modify immutable hook/bootstrap files: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx.
Backend behavior and state schema must remain unchanged for this fix.
nonGoals: Do not redesign the overall app theme or navigation IA.
Do not add new tabs or change tab routes/labels beyond what is necessary to fix clipping and apply the left shift.
